xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #phenotips on 20 March 2014
xwikidoc.content: <tian2992> has quit 03:30 <ruthgrace> has quit 08:30 <tian2992> has joined #phenotips 08:42 <Shubham1> has quit 10:50 <aw1231> has quit 12:34 <Shubham> has quit 13:18 <mcupak> has quit 13:40 <qwebirc63957> has quit 14:24 <gauravsaini03> has joined #phenotips 14:25 <akats> has joined #phenotips 14:25 <akats> allasm: This might be useful http://www.modern.ie/en-us/virtualization-tools#downloads 14:28 <gauravsaini03> has left #phenotips 15:34 <akats> sdumitriu: So there is not way to use a hibernate class without having a configuration xml file for it? 15:35 <sdumitriu> There is 15:35 <sdumitriu> Why do you say that? 15:36 <akats> I haven't been able to find it through google, and I keep getting the "Unknown entity" error 16:01 <bvancea> has joined #phenotips 17:00 <tian2992> sdumitriu: did you have a chance to check the IC predictor? 17:02 <sdumitriu> Sorry tian2992, that meeting lasted longer, and after that another meeting started that lasted until close to midnight 17:02 <sdumitriu> I'll check today 17:03 <akats> has left #phenotips 17:15 <akats> has joined #phenotips 17:21 <akats> sdumitriu: I have a question for you. https://gist.github.com/soLEED/5c0f493ca9cc1721112e 17:25 <sdumitriu> akats: Answered 17:27 <akats> Thank you 17:42 <mikola> has joined #phenotips 17:43 <mikola> Hello everybody. 17:44 <mikola> I am interested in building phenotips application and contributing to it. Can I post my questions here? 17:45 <nairboon> has quit 17:50 <sdumitriu> Hi mikola, sure 17:50 <mikola> First of let me introduce myself. 17:51 <mikola> My name is Mikalai Parafeniuk. I am a student from Belarus. 17:52 <mikola> Right now I am trying to fix some beginner bugs in project. I need some basic advices about development process. 17:52 <mikola> I have built the project and run it locally as it is described on github. 17:53 <sdumitriu> Oh, right 17:53 <sdumitriu> You asked to be assigned issues 17:53 <mikola> Which ide should i use for the project, how can I speed up the build process? 17:53 <sdumitriu> Forgot to answer, you don't need to be assigned explicitly, you can just work on those issues 17:53 <mikola> Total time: 9:27.708s 17:53 <mikola> [INFO] Finished at: Fri Mar 21 00:40:25 FET 2014 17:56 <mikola> Don't worry it is not a problem. I have already started my work. 17:57 <mikola> So, how can I improve my performance? I think that building project for 10 minutes every time is not effective. 17:58 <sdumitriu> Is that time consisten between builds? 17:59 <sdumitriu> The first build should indeed take a lot of time, but after that it should be lower 17:59 <sdumitriu> There are several things you can do 17:59 <sdumitriu> One is to build through an IDE 17:59 <sdumitriu> We try to be IDE-agnostic, so you can use what you want 17:59 <mikola> First build took about an hour to download all dependencies. 17:59 <sdumitriu> But it would be better to use something with good support for Maven 18:00 <sdumitriu> I prefer Eclipse, other prefer IntelliJ IDEA 18:00 <sdumitriu> IDEA has better support for Maven 18:01 <sdumitriu> The other thing is to not rebuild everything, but just the modules you're editing, then copy the jars you get in target/ to the running instance, and restart the server 18:01 <sdumitriu> That works well for jar modules 18:02 <sdumitriu> For ui modules, which end up in .xar, you can change the direction of the workflow and edit in the running instance, and export back the documents once you're happy with the results 18:02 <mikola> There was nearly a day between builds. 18:02 <sdumitriu> That's much faster than rebuilding the code 18:04 <sdumitriu> Example editing in the browser: http://localhost:8080/bin/edit/PhenoTips/PatientSheetCode?editor=object 18:04 <sdumitriu> You can quick save and refresh a patient profile to see the new code live 18:05 <sdumitriu> Once you save and view, you'll see an Export -> XAR entry in the menu 18:05 <sdumitriu> That is a .zip file with the source XML which you can copy back into the proper location in the source tree 18:05 <sdumitriu> Run "mvn xar:format" in the module where that XML file is (the directory with a src/ and a pom.xml) to clean up the file 18:13 <mikola> So the resources file which are the mix of xml and some language which starts with # shouldn't be edit manually? They can be edited directly in browser? 18:14 <tian2992> sdumitriu: thanks :) 18:14 <sdumitriu> They can be edited in the browser for faster results 18:14 <sdumitriu> But you can edit them on disk if you want to 18:14 <mikola> Cool %) 18:14 <mikola> :) 18:15 <sdumitriu> That's faster if you have to make minor changes and are sure of the results 18:16 <mikola> I have tried the link you provided. 18:17 <mikola> I can see some script like this http://awesomescreenshot.com/0ef2iw5kf7 18:17 <mikola> But after clicking "Save and view summary" button I can't find appropriate option in export list. 18:18 <mikola> I can see only pdf, rtf, html options. Maybe I have clicked the wrong button? 18:20 <akats> sdumitriu: I'm I being totally unreasonable here? https://gist.github.com/soLEED/9675194 18:20 <sdumitriu> Are you logged in as the Admin account? 18:20 <sdumitriu> Only admins can access that 18:21 <sdumitriu> mikola: By default you can log in with user: Admin pass: admin (case sensitive) 18:21 <mikola> I guess no. I just registered simple user. 18:21 <sdumitriu> akats: Hm, let me check 18:21 <mikola> sdmitriu: Thanks. I think that I missed that in user guide. 18:22 <sdumitriu> akats: Weird... 18:24 <mikola> sdumitriu: It works with admin rights. 18:28 <mikola> sdumitriu: I am quite impressed with project. The project size at my home directory is 1.2 GB and it starts with maven command and script execution. Also I am impressed because in pom.xml you have defined <coverage.instructionRatio>1.00</coverage.instructionRatio>. Does it really mean 100% test coverage? 18:33 <mikola> Thanks for the help. I think now I should learn some XWiki basics and setup preferred IDE to start work. 18:34 <sdumitriu> Yes 18:34 <sdumitriu> I mean yes, 100% test coverage 18:34 <sdumitriu> Although not in all modules 18:34 <sdumitriu> Some are lacking tests 18:35 <mikola> But this is still impressive. 18:35 <sdumitriu> Thank you 18:35 <sdumitriu> We're trying to keep the quality high 18:36 <sdumitriu> Although when deadlines approach, we add some technical debt which should get fixed later 18:37 <mikola> In projects where I participated such debt are not fixed for years :) 18:38 <mikola> And I have some organizational questions. 18:39 <mikola> I am planning to contribute to phenotips project as a GSOC 2014 student. 18:39 <sdumitriu> We do take care of the debt from time to time 18:40 <sdumitriu> When we need to revisit a module 18:40 <sdumitriu> We're still cleaning up the codebase 18:40 <sdumitriu> There are a few things left from the early prototyping days, but not many 18:40 <sdumitriu> What projects got your attention? 18:40 <mikola> I have created proposal and I want someone from organization to review it. I was communicating with Shankar Vembu and Quaid Morris. 18:41 <mikola> The GSOC deadline is coming but there is still no response for my mails. I have also posted to ccm-mentors@cs.toronto.edu 18:42 <mikola> I am interested in this project https://gsoc.ccm.sickkids.ca/GoogleSummerOfCode/WebHome#HDevelopmentofmachinelearningmethodsformodelingtheevolutionoftumors 18:43 <akats> has quit 18:43 <mikola> And the proposal can be found here: http://www.google-melange.com/gsoc/proposal/public/google/gsoc2014/mikalaj/5724160613416960 18:43 <sdumitriu> Well, the issue with a scientific organization is that most mentors are busy with other things; Quaid is a researcher and professor, so he's quite busy 18:44 <sdumitriu> He usually answers with some delay 18:44 <sdumitriu> Now, you should know that the CCM organization is an umbrella for different projects 18:44 <mikola> Oh, I understand. 18:44 <sdumitriu> So PhenoTips has nothing to do with that project 18:50 <sdumitriu> Also, Quaid wants C code, PhenoTips is in Java 18:50 <sdumitriu> You should remove the PhenoTips mentions from the proposal 18:53 <mikola> Thats a fail. I thought that phylosub is some kind of backend, and phenotips is frontend. 18:54 <sdumitriu> OK, the application looks good in general, but you should put more effort in the project plan / architecture part 18:54 <sdumitriu> Right now it seems pretty generic and doesn't show an understanding of the project 18:55 <mikola> And some clarification about organization structure. As I understand CCM has two main projects for GSOC - phenotips, and medsavand and some researcher tasks? 18:55 <sdumitriu> Look at the existing Python implementation, evaluate its main components and algorithms, and come up with a more detailed architecture of your planned codebase and tools you want to use 18:56 <mikola> Thanks for review. 18:56 <sdumitriu> There are multiple projects developed at the CCM, check out http://ccm.sickkids.ca/?q=node/32 18:56 <sdumitriu> But MedSavant and PhenoTips are the most advanced and maintained ones at the moment 18:57 <sdumitriu> Some of the other projects are on life support (or just history) 18:58 <sdumitriu> Other projects are more in the "researching" stage, with mainly scientific investigations going on, with a basic implementation 18:58 <sdumitriu> Other projects aren't suited for GSoC since they're not open source, or they can't easily be modularized 18:59 <sdumitriu> (or they're too small to be further divided) 18:59 <sdumitriu> Also, GeneMania participates with another organization, NRNB 19:00 <mikola> Maybe you can suggest some tools, to which I should pay attention? I thought that the main task of suggested project to research impact of parallel computation techniques and porting codebase to C++. 19:00 <sdumitriu> MedSavant and PhenoTips are actively maintained, engineering-rich, big enough projects 19:02 <sdumitriu> Besides that, there are also a few more research oriented ideas, like Quaid's two tumor projects, and Asha's extension for MedSavant 19:04 <sdumitriu> Hm, I'm not familiar with the PhyloSub code, so I can't accurately answer that 19:05 <mikola> Thanks for reply and review one more time! 19:06 <sdumitriu> But look at the data structures they use, would you use some standard C++ libraries instead, like STL? Or your own implementation? Or for better performance use raw structs with your own code on top? 19:07 <sdumitriu> Basically, provide a more detailed plan instead of the generic "port it and improve it until it's good" 19:08 <sdumitriu> Week one: convert the data structures into C++ code using the <X> library 19:08 <sdumitriu> Week two: start porting the Y algorithms 19:08 <sdumitriu> Week three: Port the other algorithms 19:09 <sdumitriu> Week four: improve these two algorithms by switching to SIMD ASM code 19:10 <sdumitriu> Week five: investigate the option of running the code on FPGAs or GPUs or whatever you find better 19:11 <sdumitriu> The competition is high, you don't have to just be the best coder, you have to convince us that you understood the task and paid enough attention to it to understand what needs to be done 19:19 <qwebirc25631> has quit 19:24 <mikola> I will definitely pay attention to existing codebase and provide more detailed plan. 19:25 <bvancea> has quit 19:46 <sdumitriu> tian2992: I'm looking at the code now 19:46 <sdumitriu> It seems that it's not the ICPredictor that does that 19:46 <sdumitriu> The document involved is PhenoTips/DiffDiagnosisService 19:47 <sdumitriu> Which calls org.phenotips.solr.OmimScriptService.getDifferentialPhenotypes 19:48 <mikola> has left #phenotips 20:20 <Shubham> has quit 20:27 <Shubham1> has quit 20:28 <dev__> has quit 20:42 <Shubham> has quit 21:00 <Shubham> has quit 21:08 <Shubham> has quit 21:14 <Shubham> has quit 21:15 <Guest83137> is now known as <sanjhee> 22:11 <sanjhee_> has quit 22:12 <sanjhee> has quit 22:31 <sdumitriu> is now known as <sdumitriu_[Away]> 23:53 <ruthgrace> has quit
